intro: Sarcomphalus retusus, commonly known as the blunt-leaf flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Linaceae family, characterized by its slender, erect stems and linear leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in loose clusters. Sarcomphalus retusus is known for its fibrous stalks, which have been historically used for textile production. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates.
